topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53631e1e6368724c56840000#post_53631e1e6368724c56840000
Do you feel charging a beach with just a broadsword, a bow and arrow?

No seriously, a soldier in world war 2 named Jack Churchill fought world war 2 with a sword and bow.  Also one battle he was the only person intact after a mortar shell killed or wounded everyone else leading a charge while he was playing the bagpipes.  When the war ended he was sad that it was over.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Did you also hear about a British Soldier who had his right arm chopped off by a Japanese soldier in Malaysia during WW2? He grabbed a sword by the blade and started killing Jap after Jap, eliminating an entire platoon until he dropped dead from blood loss.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536326ef6368720ef2df0000#post_536326ef6368720ef2df0000
That's nothing, Simo Hayh "The White Death" killed 705 soviet soldiers.  Alvin York was originally a conscientious objector and then one day he killed a fuck ton of german soldiers and took a 133 german soldiers prisoner *BY HIMSELF!*  Audie Murphy killed 240 germans; took control of a a burning M-10 tank machine gun and mowed down every last german and then a hour later exited the tank after running out of bullets and then the tank exploded.

If rambo went up against any of these three guys then rambo would be full of bullet holes.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53632b0a6368720cb66c0000#post_53632b0a6368720cb66c0000
The Russians were so scared of him, that they sent several commando teams specifically to get at him. Simo killed them ALL! The Russians carpet bombed entire forests just of snuff him out. He only had minor shrapnel wounds. He eventually got shot in the jaw, and left the battle field for the duration of the war. But he never got killed. In fact, he made a full recovery and continued his hunting hobby. Died in 2002, aged 92.

"White Death - Sabaton":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q5CaQ37VYvw
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

The soviets didn't give many fucks about their soldiers.

topics.body:
And then there's "Lauri Törni/Larry Thorne.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lauri_T%C3%B6rni 
The dude rose to the rank of captain in the Finnish army, and when the continuation war ended in 1944 he joined the SS because he wasn't done killing Russians, and reached the rank of Haupsturmführer (equivalent of Captain).

_Then_ he went on to serve in the US special forces, reaching the rank of Captain _again_ before disappearing in Vietnam.
